timeline.message:
EQL: Add Head/Tail pipe support

Introduce pipe support, in particular head and tail
(which can also be chained).

Fix failing tests

Add Head and Tail to simplify verification and future identification of
said nodes.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe name these with the plural variant, since they are arrays?
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText:
I had them as such but in case of a timestamp there's only one marker. Plus the fact that it's one or multiple fields is an implementation detail in the end.
Hence why talking a marker as an entity (which currently happens to be an array of objects) seems better.
replies.author: costin

timeline.bodyText: Since the markers can only be a combination of timestamp and tiebreaker OR only the timestamp, maybe abstract these two variants away in a TiebreakerMarker and TimestampMarker or something around these lines?
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText: I think the whole marker bit can be encapsulated in the Criterion itself, I plan to revisit this when working on the pagination.
replies.author: costin

timeline.bodyText: If the tiebreaker is not set, why still logging the square brackets?
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText: To indicate there is no tiebreaker - I find the message more consistent to be [..][] vs [..]
replies.author: costin

replies.bodyText: Myself, I wouldn't mind to have [] when there is no tiebreaker.
replies.author: matriv

replies.bodyText: How about specifying that there is no tiebreaker? (ie [...][no tiebreaker])
replies.author: astefan

timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText: same thing - I favor for since it's the most generic; in fact it might make sense to move the iterator declaration inside its declaration as well.
replies.author: costin

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this be an OR condition? Or am I missing something...
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText:
I've mentioned in the comment - checking the reachedLimit all the time does make sense but at the same time it will only increase during the last stage. Hence why checking it before is not needed.
Nevertheless I can see how this can be confusing plus I've improved the stateMachine class to have a bool and avoid the check on each method call.
replies.author: costin

timeline.bodyText: I find indexAsWildcard naming not reflecting what it actually does. Not sure where the wildcard comes from, I would name it commaDelimitedIndices or something similar.
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText:
Not sure where the wildcard comes from
From IndexResolver.resolveAsMergedMapping.

I'll rename it.
replies.author: costin

replies.bodyText: I'm not so sure about the rename...when given as a pattern index* the value of the index is said string. Using commaDelimitedIndices suggests to me that the pattern has been resolved to concrete indices vs indexAsWildcard which indicates that any potential pattern hasn't been computed yet.
replies.author: costin

replies.bodyText:
How about commaDelimitedIndexPatterns?
Agree about index*, but what about the other scenario of index1, index2, index3? There is no wildcard there. In fact, there are multiple indices even, whereas the name of the method uses the singular.
replies.author: astefan

replies.bodyText:
commaDelimitedIndexPatterns - that's a lot of chars :)
I can rename it to indexPattern but to me that's the same as wildcard (which is pattern) but a bit longer.
replies.author: costin

timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText:
I've modified it since I think the gains (less formatting) are sufficient. In general our rules tend to start with if() and I like consistency.
That and having only one return, essentially a clear exit vs multiple return paths (which is why I haven't updated PushDownOrderBy). This is mainly a styling issue but then again, we're software writers not just engineers.
replies.author: costin

timeline.author: astefan
astefan

timeline.bodyText: Where is the positive check taking place?
timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText: There isn't any :) - the check was mainly to check the integer type. I've added one.
replies.author: costin

timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText: Thanks. Used it for the existing rules
replies.author: costin

timeline.author: astefan

replies.bodyText:
command  | limit, offset
tail 10 -> -10  | 0
head 7  -> -7   | 3
tail 5  -> -5   | 3
head 3  -> -3   | 5
replies.author: costin

timeline.author: matriv
matriv
matriv
